column2: Had rain on the week of the 14th.
Level 5/16 8.3'- algae @ outlet- approx. 3' sediment @ bottom.
Lost sight of disc in sediment- looks clean as drinking water
Lots of heavy rains- level up to 9.02' 9/14
Storm on 5/28- shoreline water clear- middle is brown
Temp is 65 degrees- light overcast day- patches of duck weed- 2" of rain in the last 5 days.
Sample taken in 10.5 ft of water.
Been having lots of rain between 7/2 + 7/27/94.
Bottom 11'. ice out 4/28/96. some fishkill over winter.
Water cloudy. possibly due to heavy rain and wind.
Bottom of lake at 10.5 feet.  Ice out 4/24/97.
Water plants now growing on dry land.
Lake level remains low unless beavers return.  Persons continue to destroy the beaver dams built in the lake outlet resulting in low water level.  I fear another fish kill this winter.
Ice out 04/07- bald eagle sighted today- one loon flew over the lake this A.M.
Rainfall above avg. in May- beaver dam is rebuilt as lake is holding water level high.
Avg rainfall thus far- some bass and bluegills still carrying eggs!
Very rainy + windy past week- probably cause for secchi reading- above average rain past 2 weeks.
Record rainfall for month of July.
Rain about every other day- low water level is result of beaver dam opening up.
Beaver have repaired their dam- water rising- cool august temp thus far.
Little precipitation month of sept. lake level remains constant. it appears that weed growth in the lake is rapidly increasing + should be a concern.
mostly clear; a little wind; saw kingfisher;family of geese in marsh area; helper was Bob Grobarchik; canoed to deep hole on lake.
Breezy; partly cloudy;could see detritus floating in some areas.
Little breezy- a few clouds- air temp about 75.

Weather was sunny except for some high wispy clouds.  There was a little breeze.  Saw two bald eagles- one loon- one heron- one kingfisher.  Observed some plants in 7 feet of water.  Not sure what they were- but there was only a small area of them.

Little wind; slightly wavy; light cirrus clouds; saw 2 loons.  Observed small patch of aquatic plants in deep area.  Collected milfoil for observation-determined it was a native species- not EWM.  No sign of detritus that plagued the lake last year at this time.  Small clump of floating chara noted.
Sunny- few clouds. Breezy with light waves. 2 loons observed.

column1: The lake level has remained at about 7.9 on our staff gauge for at least 2 years- and vegetation has covered exposed shoreline.

column2: Light breeze; sunny- few clouds; 1 loon.  Air temp in 70's.
Sunny and slight breeze.  Ducks and a loon observed later in the day.
Hazy- light breeze- observed 2 mallard ducks- 2 loons. Helped by Bob Grobarchik.
Partly cloudy; air temp 80 degrees; westerly wind about 5 - 10 MPH; heard one loon. Helper was Mark Grobarchik.
Helper was Bob Grobarchik. Partly cloudy; light breeze. Saw 1 loon and a kingfisher.  Water near shore had slight greenish color- but not out farther.

Light breeze- partly cloudy- water appeared very clear- even at shore. Yesterday there was a slight algae bloom. One loon observed; kingfishers along the shore. Several frogs and a toad on shore. Bob G helped.
Clear- breezy. No wildlife observed today. Lake opened March 20-very early this year.
Slight breeze-sunny- observed kingfishers + 1 loon. Bob Grobarchik helped. Air temp 78.
Very breezy.  Mostly sunny.  Air temp 80. Saw 1 kingfisher and 1 loon. Helped by Bob Grobarchik.
Saw 2 bald eagles- 1 snapping turtle- several frogs at beach- 1 great blue heron.  Partly cloudy and a little breeze.  Air temp about 79.

Helped by Bob Grobarchik. Sunny- breezy- 2 sea gulls- kingfishers- pair of loons had an offspring this summer.  Lots of plants- mostly northern milfoil- have uprooted this summer.  Many washed up at beach. Heard that the early warm weather caused plants to not root deeply enough.
Air temp 77. Partly cloudy- light breeze. Observed box turtle on shore. Bob Grobarchik took temp.
1 eagle + heard loons.      Very breezy.  Partly to mostly cloudy. At deep hole.  Pulled up plants on Secchi disk.  They appeared to be Northern Milfoil.
Some islands of chara. Detritus on chara and along east shoreline.  Water clear at deep hole. Loons active. Bob Grobarchik helped.
Heard loon. Lots of ducks. Over 4 1/2 in. of rain recently.  Lake level on gauge 8.3 on 9-3-14. Each 0.1 on gauge represents approximately 1.25 inches. Overcast skies with light sustained breeze.

column1: Water sample from eastern shore sent to DNR because of green scum accumulating in some areas.  DNR said it was a blue-green algae bloom. Some of it was also detritus.

column2: Lots of chara floating around and on beaches.  2 herons- 1 eagle- 1 loon- 3 deer at water-2 does and one fawn.  Air temperature 86.
Air temp 62. Sunny- light breeze. Saw 4 loons- 1 bald eagle- 3 sea gulls.
some chara floating around. Dark areas (detritus ) along east shore under surface of water. Swimmer's itch evident now.  A couple of loons on lake- eagles- lots of dragonflies.
Breezy- clear day.  Some chara floating around.  No signs of phragmites on eastern shore.
2 loons on lake- mostly sunny- breezy-
Observed lake gulls- loons- very little chara and algae bloom. Breezy- partly sunny.
Observed a little chara floating- one loon. Partly sunny- light breeze.
Air 75 degrees. Little breezy- Little hazy. Observed loon with 2 babies + eagles.
Bob Grobarchik. Cloudy- very breezy. 2 1/4 inches of rain night before collection.  Loon family: 2 adults and 2 offspring.
Helped by Bob Grobarchik.  Partly cloudy- light breeze- 70 degrees.
Loons with 2 babies again this year. one gull. Bald eagles are present. A bit overcast and breezy.
Sunny- 74 degrees.  Light breeze. Water at shore very clear- but not as clear several feet from shore.  Usually- fish can be observed in 3-4 feet of water- but not today.
Loons had 2 babies again.  3 wandering loons fly over. High water all over.  Swamp overflows almost to lake.  Ducks in swamp on eastern side of lake.
Family of loons- 2 chicks-;2 ducks---teal?;an eagle;.  Very calm and sunny.
